___name.description: Generic designation of a trace in the scope of a transaction

___type.description: Keyword of specific relevance in the app's domain (eg: 'db.postgresql.query', 'template.erb', etc)

___start.description: Offset relative to the transaction's timestamp identifying the start of the trace, in milliseconds

___parent.description: The locally unique ID of the parent of the trace.

___duration.description: Duration of the trace in milliseconds

___context.description: Any other arbitrary data captured by the agent, optionally provided by the user

___db.description: An object containing contextual data for database traces

___statement.description: A database statement (e.g. query) for the given database type

___type.description: Database type. For any SQL database, "sql". For others, the lower-case database category, e.g. "cassandra", "hbase", or "redis"

___id.description: The locally unique ID of the trace.

___stacktrace.description: List of stack frames with variable attributes (eg: lineno, filename, etc)

$eref.description: A stacktrace frame, contains various bits (most optional) describing the context of the frame
$eref.title: Stacktrace

___abs_path.description: The absolute path of the file involved in the stack frame

___function.description: The function involved in the stack frame

___vars.description: Local variables for this stack frame

___pre_context.description: The lines of code before the stack frame

___context_line.description: The line of code part of the stack frame

___module.description: The module to which frame belongs to

___post_context.description: The lines of code after the stack frame

___filename.description: The relative filename of the code involved in the stack frame, used e.g. to do error checksumming

___lineno.description: The line number of code part of the stack frame, used e.g. to do error checksumming
